New Records: Rohit Sharma smashed his 5th T20 century and this has become his highest individual score.
Rohit Sharma became the only batter with 5 centuries in T20 cricket.
Key Match Events: India and Afghanistan tied the match after 20 overs with both teams scoring 212 runs.
India won the match after two super overs, taking 10 runs more than Afghanistan's score in the second super over.
Ravi Bishnoi picked up the required two wickets for India in the second super over to seal the win.
Rohit Sharma and Rinku Singh led India's batting effort, scoring 212/4 in 20 overs.
Gulbadin Naib scored a 23-ball 55 for Afghanistan, leading his team's stunning comeback.
Fareed Ahmad was the most successful bowler for Afghanistan, ending with excellent figures of 3/20.
Pre-Game Insights: India was looking to sweep the three-match T20 series against Afghanistan.
Afghanistan was trying to salvage some pride in the final encounter.
The Indian management may make some changes in the playing XI to provide opportunities to players who have been sitting on the bench.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma expressed pride in the team's resilience after a close win.
The win was a significant morale booster for India ahead of the World Cup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The M Chinnaswamy Stadium's pitch is known to favour the batters and is considered to be a paradise due to being flat and ideal for batting.
The boundaries are shorter, so the team winning the toss should bat first.
The weather conditions were supportive on match day, with no rain prediction and a temperature of around 20.8 degrees Celsius.
